revised_title: Critical Electron Velocities for Argon Ionisation and Radiation
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to determine the critical electron velocities required to produce radiation and ionisation when colliding with argon atoms. They found that ionisation occurs when the electron velocity reaches 9-10 volts, and radiation production begins at around 14-16 volts. The results provide insights into the energy levels needed for electron interactions with argon gas.
